job description:
Healthy Minds Innovations, Inc. (HMI) is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization affiliated with the Center for Healthy Minds, UW-Madison (CHM). Collectively, our mission is to cultivate well-being and relieve suffering through a scientific understanding of the mind. HMI contributes to this mission through the development and dissemination of tools and services based on scientific evidence. It also supports a social movement strategy aimed at the idea that well-being is a skill that can be learned.

Position Description

Healthy Minds Innovations is seeking a Ph.D. level scientist. This position will focus on developing and validating mobile measures to investigate skills underlying well-being. This position will support creating a mobile measures for large-scale use. The ideal candidate is highly self-motivated and capable of managing their workload and prioritizing tasks in a fast-paced environment. This full-time position is an excellent opportunity to gain substantial hands-on experience and training in many aspects of a quickly growing non-profit operation.

Responsibilities
  • Literature search and synthesis to identify candidate measures
  • Adapt and pilot measures as needed to implement on mobile devices
  • Generate specs for measures and guide mobile development with tech partners
  • Design and analyze studies to assess validity and reliability of measures on mobile
  • Maintain documentation related to measures development and validation studies
  • Present findings and recommendations to scientist and non-scientist groups
  • Support user experience research focused on in-the-world engagement with measures
Skills and Qualifications
  • Ph.D. in Psychology, Neuroscience, or a related field
  • Topical expertise in well-being, ideally including contemplative science
  • Demonstrated ability to complete projects as evidenced by first-author publications
  • Skilled at experimental design and measurement of behavior
  • Proficiency in psychometrics
  • Strong computer, statistical, and technical skills (Matlab, Python, R, or similar platforms)
  • Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills
  • Desire to work in a collaborative, multi-disciplinary environment
  • Excited about translating basic research to applied settings
Salary and Benefits:

Salary is commensurate with qualifications. HMI offers an extensive benefits package.

Healthy Minds Innovations, Inc. (HMI), is dedicated to supporting the mission of the Center for Healthy Minds, UW-Madison to cultivate well-being and relieve suffering through a scientific understanding of the mind.

HMI takes the discoveries and insights gleaned from Center research and transforms them into tools and services as well as helps manage events and public speaking engagements for the Center.

Ongoing feedback and a wider dissemination of tools will allow for larger data collection, provide refinement, generate ideas for additional research and continually inform the field of the neuroscience of well-being.
